articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: The Trump administration is appealing efforts by two judges to investigate whether government officials defied their rulings over the deportation of migrants to El Salvador, escalating a confrontation between the executive and judicial branches
articles.title: Trump challenges judges' probes of compliance with deportation orders

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas' Gaza chief said the group was ready to immediately negotiate a deal to swap all hostages for an agreed number of Palestinians jailed by Israel as part of a broader deal to end the war in the enclave.
articles.title: Hamas ready to release all remaining hostages for end to Gaza war, Hamas' Gaza chief says

articles.author: Mike Stone, Marisa Taylor
articles.description: Elon Musk's SpaceX and two partners have emerged as frontrunners to win a crucial part of President Donald Trump's "Golden Dome" missile defense shield, six people familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Musk's SpaceX is frontrunner to build Trump's Golden Dome missile shield

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court said on Thursday it will hear arguments next month over Donald Trump's bid to broadly enforce his executive order to restrict automatic birthright citizenship, a key pillar of the Republican president's hardline approach toward immigration.
articles.title: US Supreme Court to hear Trump bid to enforce birthright citizenship order

articles.author: Yuliia Dysa, Max Hunder
articles.description: Russian forces are trying out a new tactic of larger-scale assaults involving several hundred troops, according to Ukraine's military, as Kyiv girds for a new offensive push from its bigger adversary more than three years into a full-scale war.
articles.title: Russia using new mass assault tactics on battlefield, Kyiv says
Trump administration orders Gaza-linked social media vetting for visa applicants

articles.author: Nathan Frandino
articles.description: Hundreds of students, faculty and community members on a California campus booed on Thursday as speakers accused the administration of President Donald Trump of undermining American universities, as he questioned whether Harvard and others deserve tax-exempt status.
articles.title: As demonstrators accuse Trump of undermining universities, he calls Harvard 'a disgrace'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Multiple people were hospitalized on Thursday after reports of an active shooter at Florida State University and police have taken a suspect into custody, according to media reports.
articles.title: Multiple people hospitalized in shooting at Florida State University

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed Shia al-Sudani met on Thursday in Qatar with Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa, the first encounter between the two leaders, Iraqi and Syrian state news agencies reported.
articles.title: Iraqi and Syrian leaders meet in Qatar, marking a significant first encounter

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine and the United States on Thursday signed a memorandum as an initial step towards the clinching of an agreement on developing minerals in Ukraine, Yulia Svyrydenko, Ukraine's first deputy prime minister and economy minister, said.
articles.title: Ukraine, US sign memorandum on minerals deal, top Ukrainian official says
